page.title: 04A SMALL FARM IN COCKFIELD
page.content: Mr. Lilley at Palmer's Farm has 68 acres.He goes out at 7.30a.m. to feed his pigs.At 9.30 he will muck out his pigs if necessary.From 10.30,he does fieldwork if it is dry but if it is raining,he will be repairing machines until 5.30 p.m. when he will feed his pigs.He has 15 sows that are kept to farrow.Sometimes he will fatten up pigs to kill for bacon and pork.At Christmas time,he will keep about 230 turkeys and when they are big enough he will kill them and people will come and fetch them before Christmas Day.Mr.Lilley works on his own and his hours of work are 9 to 10 hours per day on weekdays and 3 hours on Sundays.Sometimes Mr. Lilley will do office work at 8 p.m.. He has 33 acres of winter wheat,17 acres of spring barley,15 acres of sugar beet and 3 acres of pasture. I am Zoe, Mr.Lilley's daughter.
